------=_NextPart_000_006B_01C2FE27.5BBFC7B0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Gordon,

I am presently working on the SEDA socket overhead determination w=
ork. I will get the results in the next two days. Some initial insights int=
o it are
- Oceanstore manages both Tx and Rx in a single stage.
- It just h=
olds the responses in memory only. It does not write into tmp files if they=
 are huge.
- TCP response reordering is done by using the seda.sandStorm.li=
b.aSocket.aSocketInputStream class which reorders packets according to the =
ATcpInPacket sequence number.

The test that will be done :
- Port the down=
loader code ( which we had written earlier during the java nio performance =
tests ) to SEDA framework and use the OceanStore library for HTTP fetching.=
 The same tests that we did for the downloader will be repeated in this oce=
anstore setup. We are removing some oceanstore code to make it similar. The=
 result of this test would tell us the percentage of overhead imposed by th=
e SEDA framework.


We are also done with the JAnt packaging scripts. It us=
es the present CVS structure itself. I shall create the proposed CVS struct=
ure after you approve it. Today we have put the cronjob for testing the web=
 hosting part of nightly builds. We shall enable it for all tomorrow. As of=
 now, only the last nightly build will be available for download. More chan=
ges need to be made for hosting every nightly build of a week.

Thanks,
Red=
dy

------=_NextPart_000_006B_01C2FE27.5BBFC7B0
